Package mod.chiselsandbits.api

Interface IChiselAndBitsAPI

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChiselAndBitsAPI
public interface IChiselAndBitsAPI
Do not implement, is passed to your IChiselsAndBitsAddon

    • registerItemStackHandler

    • getItemType

      @Nullable ItemType getItemType(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack)
      Determine the Item Type of the item in an ItemStack and return it.
      Parameters:
      stack -
      Returns:
      ItemType of the item, or null if it is not any of them.

    • canBeChiseled

      boolean canBeChiseled(net.minecraft.world.level.Level world, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos pos)
      Check if a block can support IBitAccess
      Parameters:
      world -
      pos -
      Returns:
      true if the block can be chiseled, this is true for air, multi-parts, and blocks which can be chiseled, false otherwise.

    • isBlockChiseled

      boolean isBlockChiseled(net.minecraft.world.level.Level world, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos pos)
      is this block already chiseled?
      Parameters:
      world -
      pos -
      Returns:
      true if the block contains chiseled bits, false otherwise.

    • getBitAccess

      IBitAccess getBitAccess(net.minecraft.world.level.Level world, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos pos) throws APIExceptions.CannotBeChiseled
      Get Access to the bits for a given block.
      Parameters:
      world -
      pos -
      Returns:
      A IBitAccess for the specified location.
      Throws:
      APIExceptions.CannotBeChiseled - when the location cannot support bits, or if the parameters are invalid.

    • createBitItem

      @Nullable IBitAccess createBitItem(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack)
      Create a bit access from an ItemStack, passing an empty ItemStack creates an empty bit access, passing an invalid item returns null.
      Returns:
      a IBitAccess for an ItemStack.

    • createBrush

      IBitBrush createBrush(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack) throws APIExceptions.InvalidBitItem
      Create a brush from an ItemStack, once created you can use it many times.
      Parameters:
      stack - the stack.
      Returns:
      A brush for the specified ItemStack, if passed an empty ItemStack an air brush is created.
      Throws:
      APIExceptions.InvalidBitItem

    • createBrushFromState

      IBitBrush createBrushFromState(@Nullable net.minecraft.world.level.block.state.BlockState state) throws APIExceptions.InvalidBitItem
      Create a brush from a state, once created you can use it many times.
      Parameters:
      state -
      Returns:
      A brush for the specified state, if null is passed for the item an air brush is created.
      Throws:
      APIExceptions.InvalidBitItem

    • getBitPos

      IBitLocation getBitPos(double hitX, double hitY, double hitZ, net.minecraft.core.Direction side, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos pos, boolean placement)
      Convert ray trace information into bit location information, note that the block position can change, be aware.
      Parameters:
      hitX -
      hitY -
      hitZ -
      side -
      pos -
      placement -
      Returns:
      details about the target bit, no arguments should be null.

    • getBitItem

      net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack getBitItem(net.minecraft.world.level.block.state.BlockState defaultState) throws APIExceptions.InvalidBitItem
      Get an ItemStack for the bit type of the state...

      VERY IMPORTANT: Cinvalid input: '&B' lets you disable bits, if this happens the Item in this ItemStack WILL BE empty.

      Parameters:
      defaultState -
      Returns:
      the bit.
      Throws:
      APIExceptions.InvalidBitItem

    • giveBitToPlayer

      void giveBitToPlayer(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack, net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec3 spawnPos)
      Give a bit to a player, it will end up in their inventory, a bag, or if there is no where to put it, on the ground.

      CLIENT: destroys the item.

      SERVER: adds ItemStack to inv/bag/spawns entity.

      Parameters:
      player - player to give bits to.
      stack - bits to store.
      spawnPos - if null defaults to the players position, absolute position of where to spawn bits, should be in the block near where they are being extracted from.

    • getBitbag

      @Nullable IBitBag getBitbag(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack)
      Access the contents of a bitbag as if it was a normal
      invalid reference 
      IItemHandler
      with a few extra features.
      Returns:
      internal object to manipulate bag.

    • getParameter

      <T> T getParameter(ParameterType<T> which)
      Example: int stackSize = api.getParameter(IntegerParam.BIT_BAG_MAX_STACK_SIZE );
      Parameters:
      which - - refer to ParameterType for list of possible values.
      Returns:
      value of specified parameter.

    • beginUndoGroup

      void beginUndoGroup(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player)
      Begins an undo group, starting two operations without ending the previous operation will throw a runtime exception. This is used to merge multiple blocks into a single operation, undo steps will be recorded regardless of usage of this method, however its suggested to use groups in any case where a change well affect more then one block.

    • endUndoGroup

      void endUndoGroup(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player)
      Ends a previously running undo group, must be called after starting an undo group, closing a group without opening one will result in a runtime exception.

    • getKeyBinding

      @Environment(CLIENT) net.minecraft.client.KeyMapping getKeyBinding(ModKeyBinding modKeyBinding)
      Get a Cinvalid input: '&B' key binding.
      Parameters:
      modKeyBinding - the ModKeyBinding value that denotes the Cinvalid input: '&B' key binding to return.
      Returns:
      a Cinvalid input: '&B' KeyMapping.

    • renderModel

      @Environment(CLIENT) void renderModel(com.mojang.blaze3d.vertex.PoseStack stack, net.minecraft.client.resources.model.BakedModel model, net.minecraft.world.level.Level world, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos pos, int alpha, int combinedLight, int combinedOverlay)
      Renders a model with transparency.
      Parameters:
      model -
      world -
      pos -
      alpha - Should be 0-255.

    • renderGhostModel

      @Environment(CLIENT) void renderGhostModel(com.mojang.blaze3d.vertex.PoseStack stack, net.minecraft.client.resources.model.BakedModel model, net.minecraft.world.level.Level world, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos pos, boolean isUnplaceable, int combinedLight, int combinedOverlay)
      Renders a ghost model in the same way that chiseled item blocks are rendered for placement.
      Parameters:
      model -
      world -
      pos -
      isUnplaceable - if true, the block will be rendered with a decreased alpha value.
